Escape ( $  str,
$  chars,
$  no_double_escapes = TRUE 
)

Escapes chars.

Prevents double escapes by default.

preg_quote() double escapes, thus is not suitable. It is not possible to make sure that strings contain no escapes, because this function is used over strings obtained from config files too, which we don't have any control over.

Example: $no_double_escapes as FALSE is used in the code to double escape $ char.

Parameters:
[in] $str string String to process.
[in] $chars string Chars to escape.
[in] $no_double_escapes boolean Whether to prevent double escapes.
Returns:
Escaped string.

First remove existing escapes

ViewError ( $  msg  ) 

Sets or updates $ViewError with the given message.

Error strings are accumulated in global $ViewError and returned to View.

Parameters:
[in] $msg string Error message.
